text: Qatar at the Olympics is a history which includes 8 games in 7 countries and 100+ athletes.SportsReference.com (SR/Olympics), Qatar ; retrieved 2012-10-12. Since 1979, Oman has contributed to the growth of the "Olympic Movement".Olympics.org, "Factsheet: The Olympic Movement"; retrieved 2012-10-12. The International Olympic Committee's official abbreviation for Qatar is QAT."Abbreviations, National Olympic Committees," 2009 Annual Report, p. 91 [PDF p. 92 of 94]; retrieved 2012-10-12. ==History== The Qatar Olympic Committee was formed in 1979 and recognized by the IOC in 1980.Olympic.org, Qatar; retrieved 2012-10-12. Teams from Qatar have taken part in the Summer Olympic Games but is scheduled to its Winter Olympic Games debut in 2026. After the 2008 Summer Olympics, Qatar was, along with Saudi Arabia and Brunei, one of only three countries to never send a female athlete to the Olympic Games. The International Olympic Committee in 2010 said it would "press" these countries to have women's participate. Then the Qatar Olympic Committee said it "hoped to send up to four female athletes in shooting and fencing" to the 2012 Summer Games in London."Qatar decision to send female athletes to London 2012 increases pressure on Saudi Arabia", Inside the Games, July 1, 2010"Inside Lines: Protests at 2012 if Saudis say 'no girls allowed'", The Independent, July 4, 2010 ==Medalists== Medal Name Games Sport Event Mohammed Suleiman 1992 Barcelona Athletics Men's 1,500m Said Saif Asaad 2000 Sydney Weightlifting Men's 105 kg class Nasser Al-Attiyah 2012 London Shooting Men's skeet Mutaz Essa Barshim 2012 London Athletics Men's high jump ==Related pages== * List of IOC country codes ==References== ==Other websites== * Qatar profile at London2012.com * "Qatar using black gold to tap into top performers", The Guardian, December 13, 2005 (on Olympic competitors from various countries switching to Qatari citizenship) *home page Category:Nations at the Olympics Category:National sports teams of Qatar
title: Qatar at the Olympics
